translated: In Tibetan:

analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi snang ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The Illumination of Reality

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Hevajra.

analyzed: keng rus mtha' ni 'khor byed sprin tshogs 'dral zhing dri med nam mkha'i lam yin pa //
translated: The path of the stainless sky, which is the garland of skeletons that encircles the edge of saṃsāra,

original: rdo rje'i 'od zer spro byed seng ge dbang po tshangs pa skrag 'gyur bstod 'os pa //
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'od zer spro byed seng ge dbang po tshangs pa skrag 'gyur bstod 'os pa //
translated: The lion-like one who radiates vajra light rays, worthy of praise, terrifying Brahmā and Indra,

original: bskal mtha'i chu sbyin sgra bzhin sgra snyan 'jam 'gyur h'um gi yi ge sgrar 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bskal mtha'i chu sbyin sgra bzhin sgra snyan 'jam 'gyur h'um gi yi ge sgrar 'gyur ba //
translated: The one whose voice is sweet and gentle like the sound of the water-gift at the end of an eon, with the sound of the syllable hūṃ,🔽May the dance of Heruka, who terrifies the four māras with fear and is worshipped by the three worlds, protect you.🔽With knees placed on the ground like a black mountain, with the sweet sound of jana jana,

original: 'jigs pas bdud bzhi skrag cing srid gsum gyis ni phyag byas he ru ka yi gar khyod skyong gyur cig / nag 'gyur sa 'dzin dang 'dra 'jam pa'i dzan na dzan sgrar 'gyur ba'i pus mo'i zung dgod dang // dpung par 'jigs pa'i spyan gsum gyis ni blta bas lha rnams skrag par mdzad pa dang //
analyzed: 'jigs pas bdud bzhi skrag cing srid gsum gyis ni phyag byas he ru ka yi gar khyod skyong gyur cig / nag 'gyur sa 'dzin dang 'dra 'jam pa'i dzan na dzan sgrar 'gyur ba'i pus mo'i zung dgod dang // dpung par 'jigs pa'i spyan gsum gyis ni blta bas lha rnams skrag par mdzad pa dang //
translated: With the three eyes of fear looking on the arms, causing the gods to be frightened,

original: spros 'gyur rengs pa'i khro gnyer 'joms pa bstan te zhal ni mi bzad pa //
analyzed: spros 'gyur rengs pa'i khro gnyer 'joms pa bstan te zhal ni mi bzad pa //
translated: The terrifying face is shown to destroy the frowns of those who are rigid with conceptual elaboration.🔽May the glorious Vajradaka, who is like a blue lotus, protect the bodies of beings with his own body.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro autpala sngo 'dra rang skus lus can skyob gyur cig / rdo rje sems dpa' gnang ba yis //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje mkha' 'gro autpala sngo 'dra rang skus lus can skyob gyur cig / rdo rje sems dpa' gnang ba yis //
translated: By the permission of Vajrasattva,🔽I will write the treatise called the Illumination of Reality

original: snying rjes sems can rnams la ni //🔽de nyid snang ba zhes bya ba //
analyzed: snying rjes sems can rnams la ni // de nyid snang ba zhes bya ba //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings out of compassion.

original: de ni bdag gis bri bar bya //🔽gdul bar dka' bar gyur pa yis //
analyzed: de ni bdag gis bri bar bya // gdul bar dka' bar gyur pa yis //
translated: I will write it🔽In order to place the mind on the path

original: sems ni lam la gzhug pa'i phyir //🔽bdag gis nan tan byed pa la //
analyzed: sems ni lam la gzhug pa'i phyir // bdag gis nan tan byed pa la //
translated: Of those who are difficult to tame.🔽Those who know reality, please forgive me

original: de nyid rig mkhan bzod par mdzod //
analyzed: de nyid rig mkhan bzod par mdzod //
translated: For my insistence in doing this.

original: rgyud ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje rgyud sogs snying po ste //
analyzed: rgyud ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje rgyud sogs snying po ste //
translated: The tantras are the Essence Tantra of the Hevajra Tantra and so forth.

original: bde gshegs kyis bstan nan tan gyis ni bzung nas su //
analyzed: bde gshegs kyis bstan nan tan gyis ni bzung nas su //
translated: Having been taught by the Sugata and upheld with effort,

original: sna tshogs skyed byed bstan bcos de nyid snang ba ni //
analyzed: sna tshogs skyed byed bstan bcos de nyid snang ba ni //
translated: The treatise that generates various things, the Illumination of Reality,

original: 'gro la phan thogs phyir ni bdag gis bstan par bya //
analyzed: 'gro la phan thogs phyir ni bdag gis bstan par bya //
translated: I will teach it in order to benefit migrating beings.

original: dang por re zhig slob mas bla ma'i phyogs su blta zhing mandala gyi cho ga byas la /
analyzed: dang por re zhig slob mas bla ma'i phyogs su blta zhing mandala gyi cho ga byas la /
translated: First, the disciple should look toward the teacher and perform the rite of the maṇḍala.

original: de nas sems can rnams skyo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir //🔽'gro la phan thogs don du sangs rgyas @154b 'gyur bar shog / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nas sems can rnams skyo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir // 'gro la phan thogs don du sangs rgyas @154b 'gyur bar shog / ces bya ba ste /
translated: Then, in order to generate disgust in sentient beings,

original: dam bca' bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam bca' bar bya'o //
translated: one should make the vow:🔽“May I become a Buddha for the benefit of the world.”

original: de nas bdag nyid bla ma la dbul bya //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid bla ma la dbul bya //
translated: Then, one should offer oneself to the teacher.

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'o /
translated: This is generosity.

original: dam pa min pa'i lam la sems 'jug par 'gyur ba las ldog pa zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dam pa min pa'i lam la sems 'jug par 'gyur ba las ldog pa zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality is the restraint of the mind from engaging in the path of the non-virtuous.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bzod pa'o //
translated: The patience is the arising of the mind, speech, and body.

original: sngon gyi dam bca' ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i grub pa zhes bya ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: sngon gyi dam bca' ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i grub pa zhes bya ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort is the accomplishment of fulfilling the previous vow.

original: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan no //
translated: The meditation is the one-pointed mind.

original: 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nges par shes pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi ming thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nges par shes pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi ming thob pa'o //
translated: All of these are called “the certain knowledge that they are devoid of intrinsic nature,” and that is what is meant by “the attainment of wisdom.”

original: de bas na shes rab dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lngas ming thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lngas ming thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the five perfections of generosity and so on, when endowed with wisdom, are said to “attain their names.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rten par byed cing mi dge ba'i las bcu yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rten par byed cing mi dge ba'i las bcu yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should rely on the six perfections and completely abandon the ten nonvirtuous actions.

original: de rnams kyang lus dang ngag dang sems la brten par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang lus dang ngag dang sems la brten par gyur pa'o //
translated: Those are based on body, speech, and mind.

original: lus ni ngag la brten pa dang / ngag ni sems la brten pa dang / sems ni nam mkha' la brten pa ste /
analyzed: lus ni ngag la brten pa dang / ngag ni sems la brten pa dang / sems ni nam mkha' la brten pa ste /
translated: The body is based on speech, speech is based on the mind, and the mind is based on space.

original: nam mkha' ni gang la yang brten par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gang la yang brten par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Space is not based on anything.

original: de bas na 'bad pa thams cad kyis /
analyzed: de bas na 'bad pa thams cad kyis /
translated: Therefore, with all your effort,

original: gsum po 'di nyid dri ma med par byas la /
analyzed: gsum po 'di nyid dri ma med par byas la /
translated: purify these three.

original: slar yang gsum po 'di nyid la rnam par bshad par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang gsum po 'di nyid la rnam par bshad par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, these three should be explained again.

original: 'di lta ste lus ni gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lus ni gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Namely, the body is like a reflection,

original: ngag ni sgra brnyan bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ngag ni sgra brnyan bzhin du'o //
translated: speech is like an echo,

original: sems ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: and the mind is equal to space.

original: gsum po de ni shes rab dang ldan pas rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsum po de ni shes rab dang ldan pas rnam par dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These three become pure through wisdom.

original: de lta bas na mi dge ba bcus gnod par mi byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi dge ba bcus gnod par mi byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the ten non-virtues do not harm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sngon du las rjes su dran par spyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sngon du las rjes su dran par spyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva should practice mindfulness of karma.

original: las dang po pa'i dum bu ste dang po'o /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i dum bu ste dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter on the beginner's section.

original: // / de nas sngags bstan pa'i rgyud rnam pa bzhi las sngags kyi dngos grub bsgrub pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: // / de nas sngags bstan pa'i rgyud rnam pa bzhi las sngags kyi dngos grub bsgrub pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Now, from among the four types of tantras that teach mantras, the accomplishment of mantra siddhis and so forth,

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de thams cad /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de thams cad /
translated: whatever was taught by the Blessed One,

original: ngan song du gnas pa'i sems can rnams bkug nas dam pa'i lam la dgod pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: ngan song du gnas pa'i sems can rnams bkug nas dam pa'i lam la dgod pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: all of that was taught in order to summon sentient beings dwelling in lower realms and establish them on the true path.

original: bstan pa yang tha ma dang 'bring dang rab dang sems can gyi bsam pa rab tu dbye bas sna tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan pa yang tha ma dang 'bring dang rab dang sems can gyi bsam pa rab tu dbye bas sna tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The teaching is also various, because of the various dispositions of sentient beings, as inferior, middling, and superior.

original: dper na gcig pu ni gcig min 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na gcig pu ni gcig min 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as one thing is not many, so it is.

original: ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: @155a * // dper na chus gang bar gyur pa'i chu snod rnams la zla ba gcig yin yang gzugs brnyan du mar gyur pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @155a * // dper na chus gang bar gyur pa'i chu snod rnams la zla ba gcig yin yang gzugs brnyan du mar gyur pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the moon, which is one, is many in the water, in the various water-filled vessels.

original: de bas na theg pa thams cad las de kho na nyid gcig pu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin par rtogs par gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na theg pa thams cad las de kho na nyid gcig pu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin par rtogs par gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, understand that in all the vehicles, reality is one, and not another.

original: de ltar gtan la phebs nas sngon gyi dam bca' yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gtan la phebs nas sngon gyi dam bca' yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus established it, in order to fulfill the former vow,

original: skye ba 'di la nyin mtshan du byang chub bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di la nyin mtshan du byang chub bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: one should practice enlightenment day and night in this life.

original: de nas gal te bsgrub par ma nus na de lta na ni /
analyzed: de nas gal te bsgrub par ma nus na de lta na ni /
translated: Then, if one is not able to practice, in that case,

original: bsod nams la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: bsod nams la spyad par bya ste /
translated: one should practice merit.

original: bsod nams kyi mthu des ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gzhan la byang chub bsgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //🔽khro ba dang ser sna dang nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang chang dang sha la sogs pa la rjes su chags par gyur pa gang rnams kyis bstan pa so so ru go bar byed pa de rnams kyis nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
analyzed: bsod nams kyi mthu des ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gzhan la byang chub bsgrub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o // khro ba dang ser sna dang nga rgyal dang ldan pa dang chang dang sha la sogs pa la rjes su chags par gyur pa gang rnams kyis bstan pa so so ru go bar byed pa de rnams kyis nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i
translated: By the power of that merit, in the future they will accomplish enlightenment for others.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Those who are angry, stingy, proud, attached to alcohol, meat, and so on, and who teach the Dharma for individual understanding, are unable to teach the characteristics of the causes and effects of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: longs spyod kyi don du de rnams kyi slob ma gzung bar byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos 'tshong ba dang / log par 'tsho bar byed pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa dang bral bas dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ba dang / don med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi don du de rnams kyi slob ma gzung bar byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos 'tshong ba dang / log par 'tsho bar byed pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa dang bral bas dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur ba dang / don med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For the sake of wealth, they take on disciples, sell the true Dharma, engage in wrong livelihood, and fall into hell due to being devoid of blessings, becoming meaningless.

original: de nas 'byung ba lnga dang khams lnga la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams sems kyi phun sum tshogs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas 'byung ba lnga dang khams lnga la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams sems kyi phun sum tshogs pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Then, whatever there is of the five elements, the five constituents, and so on, that is the abundance of mind, and not anything else.

original: dper na rmi lam du bdag dang bral bar gyur pa'i 'gyur ba rnams gang skyes pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las 'das par gyur pa'i zla ba'i gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba dang / sgra brnyan dang 'dra ba dang / bri za'i grong khyer bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam du bdag dang bral bar gyur pa'i 'gyur ba rnams gang skyes pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las 'das par gyur pa'i zla ba'i gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba dang / sgra brnyan dang 'dra ba dang / bri za'i grong khyer bzhin du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: For example, one should understand that the changes that occur in dreams, which are devoid of a self, are like the reflection of the moon, which is beyond the grasped and the grasper, like an echo, and like a city of gandharvas.

original: sems kyang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang song ba dang 'ongs pa las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang bar dad tha ma las rnam par grol ba yin la /
analyzed: sems kyang skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa dang song ba dang 'ongs pa las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang bar dad tha ma las rnam par grol ba yin la /
translated: The mind is also beyond arising, enduring, and ceasing, beyond going and coming, and is free from a beginning, middle, and end.

original: gnas pa gang las kyang thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa gang las kyang thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not obtained from any abiding whatsoever.

original: shes rab dang ldan par gyur pa 'di nyid 'di ni srid pa gsum la rol bar mdzad pa de /
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan par gyur pa 'di nyid 'di ni srid pa gsum la rol bar mdzad pa de /
translated: This very one who possesses wisdom is the one who plays in the three existences.

original: dper na rdzu 'phrul mkhan skyes bu gang zhig gis /
analyzed: dper na rdzu 'phrul mkhan skyes bu gang zhig gis /
translated: For example, just as a magician,

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i tshul gyis mi rnams la ngo mtshar bar ston par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sems kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i tshul gyis mi rnams la ngo mtshar bar ston par byed pa ji lta ba de bzhin du sems kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: a person, shows people something amazing by the way of creation, abiding, and destruction, so should the mind be understood.

original: de ltar brjod par gyur pa'i thabs rnal 'byor bas rig na /
analyzed: de ltar brjod par gyur pa'i thabs rnal 'byor bas rig na /
translated: If the yogi knows the method that has been expressed in this way,

original: sems kyi sa la gnod par mi 'gyur @155b te /
analyzed: sems kyi sa la gnod par mi 'gyur @155b te /
translated: he will not be harmed by the stage of the mind.

original: rnal 'byor pas sems shes par gyur na chags pa dang bral bar nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas sems shes par gyur na chags pa dang bral bar nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If the yogi knows the mind, he will be free from attachment and will be like space.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid 'chi bar gyur na yang rung skad cig gis 'tsho bar gyur na yang rung ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bzhin du spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid 'chi bar gyur na yang rung skad cig gis 'tsho bar gyur na yang rung ste /
translated: Like a wish-fulfilling jewel, he will be the lord of emanation and dissolution, even if he dies, or if he lives for an instant.

original: dus kyis mi 'tsho ba la smos ci dgos /
analyzed: dus kyis mi 'tsho ba la smos ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention that he will not die by the passage of time?

original: de ltar nyams sum myong bar thos pa tsam gyis don med de /
analyzed: de ltar nyams sum myong bar thos pa tsam gyis don med de /
translated: In that way, mere hearing is meaningless without experience.

original: dper na sman dpyad bklags pa tsam gyis nad pa la nad zhi bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na sman dpyad bklags pa tsam gyis nad pa la nad zhi bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin du'o //
translated: For example, a patient is not cured merely by reading the medical treatise.

original: de bas na nyams su myong ba'i sbyor bas 'bras bu rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na nyams su myong ba'i sbyor bas 'bras bu rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the result is perfected by the practice of experience.

original: rgyu de'i phyir sems rtogs par gyur na thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir sems rtogs par gyur na thams cad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, when the mind is realized, everything arises.

original: shes rab dang sems kyi mtshan nyid ni dbang dang bla ma'i drin gyis shes par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang sems kyi mtshan nyid ni dbang dang bla ma'i drin gyis shes par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of wisdom and mind is said to be known through the kindness of the master and the empowerment.

original: spyi'i gleng gzhi'i dum bu ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: spyi'i gleng gzhi'i dum bu ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter, the general nidāna.

original: // / de nas slob ma rnams la dbang yang dag par sbyin pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas slob ma rnams la dbang yang dag par sbyin pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Next, the explanation of the empowerment that is perfectly bestowed upon the disciples will be explained.

original: jun tshon dgye bzhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyis shes rab yin la /
analyzed: jun tshon dgye bzhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyis shes rab yin la /
translated: The so-called arraying the colors is wisdom in the definitive meaning,

original: 'gro ba thams cad mtshon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad mtshon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it illustrates all migrating beings.

original: de la dgye ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pas na ra dza ba da'o //
analyzed: de la dgye ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pas na ra dza ba da'o //
translated: There, arraying is rajas, because it is grasping.

original: de nyid lha'i dkyil 'khor yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid lha'i dkyil 'khor yin gyi /
translated: That itself is the maṇḍala of deities.

original: lha rnams la spyan 'dren pa dang / gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: lha rnams la spyan 'dren pa dang / gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no /
translated: It is not the case that the gods are invited or requested to depart.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byon pa dang gshegs pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byon pa dang gshegs pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are not known to come or go.

original: dper na rmi lam na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa med pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa med pa bzhin du'o //
translated: For example, just as there is no arising, enduring, or ceasing in a dream.

original: rgyu de'i phyir lha rnams la spyan 'dren pa dang gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa mi bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir lha rnams la spyan 'dren pa dang gshegs su gsol ba la sogs pa mi bya ste /
translated: For that reason, one should not invite the gods or request them to depart.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyis 'khor ba'i 'ching ba las grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam gtan gyis 'khor ba'i 'ching ba las grol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One will not be liberated from the bondage of saṃsāra by a meditation that has an object.

original: med pa'i dngos po la smos ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i dngos po la smos ci dgos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What need is there to mention non-existent things?

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad la mi dmigs pas thams cad la'o //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad la mi dmigs pas thams cad la'o //
translated: Therefore, by not objectifying all things, one is liberated from all things.

original: dngos po dang dngos po min pa las grol bar gyur pa'i sems ni sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po min pa las grol bar gyur pa'i sems ni sangs rgyas zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: The mind that is liberated from things and non-things is called “Buddha.”

original: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid gtso bo de lta bu las /
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid gtso bo de lta bu las /
translated: From such a principal [mind] that is the nature of method and wisdom,

original: sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pas mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should worship with mantras, seals, and so forth.

original: ji ltar mchod par bgyi zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mchod par bgyi zhe na /
translated: How should one worship?

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i sems gcig tu bya ba ni sngags so //
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i sems gcig tu bya ba ni sngags so //
translated: The mantra is the unification of pure and impure minds.

original: de bzhin du skye dgu rnams kyi skye ba ni bzlas pa yin la 'jig rten gsum po rgyas gdab par byed pas na phyag rgya yin la de shes rab tu brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye dgu rnams kyi skye ba ni bzlas pa yin la 'jig rten gsum po rgyas gdab par byed pas na phyag rgya yin la de shes rab tu brjod de /
translated: Likewise, the birth of living beings is the repetition, and since one seals the three worlds, it is the seal. That is called wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi mandala de mdun du byas nas /🔽slob ma rnams @156a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mandala de mdun du byas nas / slob ma rnams @156a * //
translated: Having made that wisdom mandala in front,🔽one should bestow the various initiations

original: la dbang sna tshogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: la dbang sna tshogs pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: on the disciples.

original: dbang las ma gtogs par dngos grub med de /
analyzed: dbang las ma gtogs par dngos grub med de /
translated: There is no power apart from the initiation.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa las dbang sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa las dbang sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should bestow the initiation for the sake of the fruit of buddhahood itself.

original: slob mas kyang zhu ba 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: slob mas kyang zhu ba 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The disciple should make this request:

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying gyur ba //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying gyur ba //
translated: I am sunk in the mire of cyclic existence,

original: mi bzad sdig pa byas pas g-yogs //🔽de ltar bdag ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: mi bzad sdig pa byas pas g-yogs // de ltar bdag ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: covered by the unbearable obscurations created by evil deeds.🔽In order to emerge from that,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas skyob par mdzod //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas skyob par mdzod //
translated: the Tathagata should protect me.

original: ces bya'o // de nas slob ma la bla mas dbang bdun po sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de nas slob ma la bla mas dbang bdun po sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Then the guru should bestow the seven empowerments on the disciple.

original: chu'i dbang sbyin pa dang cod pan gyi dbang dang // rdo rje'i dbang dang / bdag po'i dbang dang / ming gi dbang dang / gsang ba'i dbang dang / shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: chu'i dbang sbyin pa dang cod pan gyi dbang dang // rdo rje'i dbang dang / bdag po'i dbang dang / ming gi dbang dang / gsang ba'i dbang dang / shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ngo //
translated: They are the water empowerment, crown empowerment, vajra empowerment, lord empowerment, name empowerment, secret empowerment, and wisdom-awareness empowerment.

original: dang por re zhig me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad yin la /
analyzed: dang por re zhig me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad yin la /
translated: First, the nature of mirrorlike timeless awareness is Vairocana.

original: chags pa med par gyur pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: chags pa med par gyur pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Since he is free of attachment, he is Vairocana.

original: de dbang bskur ba zhes bya ste chu'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: de dbang bskur ba zhes bya ste chu'i dbang ngo //
translated: That is called “empowerment,” the water empowerment.

original: de nas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: de nas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Next, the nature of the utterly pure basic space of phenomena is Akṣobhya.

original: bskyod par mi 'gyur bas na mi bskyod pa yin la /
analyzed: bskyod par mi 'gyur bas na mi bskyod pa yin la /
translated: Since he is unmoved, he is Akṣobhya.

original: de mgo bo la gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de mgo bo la gzung bar bya ste /
translated: He should be held on the head.

original: cod pan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: cod pan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: That is the crown empowerment.

original: de nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid rin chen 'byung ldan yin la /
analyzed: de nas mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid rin chen 'byung ldan yin la /
translated: Next, the nature of the timeless awareness of equalness is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: gnyis po ma lus pa'i chags pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur bas na rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: gnyis po ma lus pa'i chags pa med par 'byung bar 'gyur bas na rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: Since he is the one who causes the arising of the two, the inexhaustible adornments of the body and speech of all buddhas, he is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: des dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: des dbang bskur ba ni rdo rje'i dbang ngo //
translated: The empowerment conferred by him is the vajra empowerment.

original: de nas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid snang ba mtha' yas yin la /
analyzed: de nas so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid snang ba mtha' yas yin la /
translated: Then, the one who is the nature of the discriminating wisdom is Amitābha.

original: mtha' yas na tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas na tshad med pa ste /
translated: Since he is infinite, he is immeasurable.

original: snang ba ni 'od zer gang la yod pa de snang ba mtha' yas se //
analyzed: snang ba ni 'od zer gang la yod pa de snang ba mtha' yas se //
translated: The one who has light, radiance, is Amitābha.

original: des dbang bskur bas ni bdag po'i dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des dbang bskur bas ni bdag po'i dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: The empowerment conferred by him is called the lord empowerment.

original: de nas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid don yod grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid don yod grub pa yin te /
translated: Then, the one who is the nature of the wisdom of successful activities is Amoghasiddhi.

original: don grub ces bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i grub pa yin la /
analyzed: don grub ces bya ba ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i grub pa yin la /
translated: The one called “successful” is the one who is successful with a result.

original: des ming gi dbang bskur ba ming gi dbang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des ming gi dbang bskur ba ming gi dbang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The empowerment conferred by him is the name empowerment, called the name empowerment.

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He is Vajrasattva, the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Vajra means

original: mi phyed pa'i stong pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i stong pa nyid yin la /
translated: indivisible emptiness.

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni srid pa gsum gyi gcig pa nyid snying rje ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni srid pa gsum gyi gcig pa nyid snying rje ste /
translated: The hero is the sole reality of the three worlds, compassion.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: It is Vajrasattva.

original: gsang ba ni gnyis po ma lus pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gtan la 'bebs pa yin la /
analyzed: gsang ba ni gnyis po ma lus pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gtan la 'bebs pa yin la /
translated: The secret is the ascertainment of nondual intuition, because it generates all the two.

original: des dbang bskur ba ni gsang ba'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: des dbang bskur ba ni gsang ba'i dbang ngo //
translated: The empowerment by that is the secret empowerment.

original: shes rab ye shes zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i khams @156b yin la /
analyzed: shes rab ye shes zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i khams @156b yin la /
translated: The wisdom is the realm of space, the realm of phenomena devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: ye shes ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las 'das pa ste /
translated: The intuition is the transcendence of the grasped and the grasper.

original: des dbang bskur ba ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: des dbang bskur ba ni shes rab ye shes kyi dbang ngo //
translated: The empowerment by that is the wisdom-intuition empowerment.

original: stong nyid ye shes brjod pa dang / snying rje gsal ba thabs yin no //
analyzed: stong nyid ye shes brjod pa dang / snying rje gsal ba thabs yin no //
translated: The expression emptiness-intuition is the method, the manifestation of compassion.

original: gnyis ka gcig tu sbyor ba las /
analyzed: gnyis ka gcig tu sbyor ba las /
translated: From the union of the two as one,

original: bdud rtsi'i mchog ni 'dzag par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i mchog ni 'dzag par 'gyur // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the supreme nectar trickles.

original: dbang gzhan ma gang rnams yod pa de rnams de nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang gzhan ma gang rnams yod pa de rnams de nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The other empowerments that exist should be understood in the same way.

original: lan cig phyi'am nang du de rnams kyi don ni yang dag par sbyin pas gtan la phebs par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyi'am nang du de rnams kyi don ni yang dag par sbyin pas gtan la phebs par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One should determine the meaning of those by means of the correct bestowal of the initiation, either externally or internally.

original: dbang gi dum bu ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: dbang gi dum bu ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third chapter, the chapter on the initiation.

original: // / da ni de'i don gtan la 'bebs par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni de'i don gtan la 'bebs par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to determine the meaning of that,

original: rtsa gsum gyi dbye ba bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa gsum gyi dbye ba bri bar bya ste /
translated: the division of the three channels should be drawn.

original: la la n'a ni g-yon nas 'bab par byed pa a'a li'i rang bzhin thabs so //
analyzed: la la n'a ni g-yon nas 'bab par byed pa a'a li'i rang bzhin thabs so //
translated: Lalana is the nature of ali, the method that flows from the left.

original: ra sa n'a ni g-yas nas 'bab par byed pa k'a li'i rang bzhin shes rab bo //
analyzed: ra sa n'a ni g-yas nas 'bab par byed pa k'a li'i rang bzhin shes rab bo //
translated: Rasana is the nature of kali, wisdom that flows from the right.

original: gnyis ka gcig pa nyid kyi dbus su aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka gcig pa nyid kyi dbus su aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
translated: The two are one in the middle, the avadhuti.

original: la la n'a chos dang / ra sa n'a la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / aa wa dh'u t'i la sbal pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: la la n'a chos dang / ra sa n'a la longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / aa wa dh'u t'i la sbal pa'i sku ste /
translated: Lalana is the dharma, rasana is the enjoyment, and avadhuti is the emanation body.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi dbye bas so //
translated: [They are] the division of body, speech, and mind.

original: rtsa gsum dang 'khor lo bzhi la gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: rtsa gsum dang 'khor lo bzhi la gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bas bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The great bliss is the union of the three channels and the four chakras.

original: bzhi po 'di rnams las sprul pa la byams pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams las sprul pa la byams pa'o //
translated: From those four, love is emanation.

original: chos la snying rje'o //
analyzed: chos la snying rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the Dharma.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the Enjoyment Body.

original: bde ba chen po la btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po la btang snyoms so //
translated: Equanimity is the Great Bliss.

original: de bzhin du skad cig bzhis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig bzhis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, there are four moments of arising:

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyid pa dang / mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par nyid pa dang / mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: the various, the matured, the purified, and the one free from characteristics.

original: bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four truths:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mo /
translated: suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.

original: de kho na nyid bzhi ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bzhi ste /
translated: There are four realities:

original: bdag gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: the reality of the self, the reality of the mantra, the reality of the deity, and the reality of wisdom.

original: dga' ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi ste /
translated: There are four joys:

original: dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi dga' ba dang / ldan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' bral gyi dga' ba dang / ldan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: joy, supreme joy, the joy of separation, and the connate joy.

original: sde pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sde pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four schools:

original: gnas brtan pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mang pos bkur ba dang / phal chen no //
analyzed: gnas brtan pa dang / thams cad yod par smra ba dang / mang pos bkur ba dang / phal chen no //
translated: the Sthaviras, the Sarvāstivādins, the Saṃmitīyas, and the Mahāsāṅghikas.

original: byams pa la sogs pa 'di rnams ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa 'di rnams ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are these, love and so on, to be cultivated?

original: thams cad du ro mnyam pa nyid kyi gang blo gnas par 'gyur ba de byams pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ro mnyam pa nyid kyi gang blo gnas par 'gyur ba de byams pa'o //
translated: Love is the abiding of the mind in the sameness of taste of all things.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi bdag nyid gang sems yin pa de snying rje'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi bdag nyid gang sems yin pa de snying rje'o //
translated: Compassion is the mind that is the nature of former vows.

original: 'di dag la gcig pa de nyid gang yin pa de dga' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la gcig pa de nyid gang yin pa de dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the sameness of these two, love and compassion.

original: @157a * // thams cad la ltos pa med pa'i blo gang yin pa de btang snyoms so //
analyzed: @157a * // thams cad la ltos pa med pa'i blo gang yin pa de btang snyoms so //
translated: Equanimity is the mind that is indifferent to all things.

original: sprul pa la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: sprul pa la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How are emanation and so on to be cultivated?

original: sems can ma lus pa rnams ni /🔽gang du skye bar brjod pa de //🔽de ru sprul pa'i sku yin te //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa rnams ni / gang du skye bar brjod pa de // de ru sprul pa'i sku yin te //
translated: Emanation is the mind that is the nature of the body of magical emanation.

original: de ni sprul par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni sprul par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said to be emanation because it is the expression of the body of magical emanation in all places where sentient beings are born.

original: yang na spyo bar byed pas na sprul pa'o //
analyzed: yang na spyo bar byed pas na sprul pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is emanation because it is the emanation of the body of magical emanation.

original: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir sems kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The Dharma is the nature of the mind because it holds the intrinsic identity of all things.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni mngar ba la sogs pa ro drug la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni mngar ba la sogs pa ro drug la spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The enjoyment is the enjoyment of the six flavors, sweet and so on.

original: sku gsum gyi dbye bas 'di rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: sku gsum gyi dbye bas 'di rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: These are the divisions of the three bodies.

original: de rnams yongs su shes par byed pas bde ba chen po'o /
analyzed: de rnams yongs su shes par byed pas bde ba chen po'o /
translated: The great bliss is the one who causes the complete understanding of these.

original: 'khor lo 'di rnams la rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i skad cig rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'di rnams la rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa'i skad cig rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: The moments of the various types, etc., should be understood in these wheels.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa la sogs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are the various types, etc.?

original: 'khyud pa dang tsumba na la sogs pa sna tshogs par byed pas na rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khyud pa dang tsumba na la sogs pa sna tshogs par byed pas na rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The various types are the various types of embracing, kissing, etc.

original: ye shes kyi bde ba la spyod pas ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi bde ba la spyod pas ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The fully matured is the enjoyment of the bliss of intuition.

original: thams cad mnyes par byed pas na rnam pa med pa ste rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mnyes par byed pas na rnam pa med pa ste rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: The non-type is the one who pleases all, who is just without intrinsic reality.

original: chags pa dang bral bar gyur pas ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral bar gyur pas ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: The one devoid of characteristics is the one who is free from attachment.

original: skad cig 'di rnams las dga' ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig 'di rnams las dga' ba la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From these moments, joy, etc., arise.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs la dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is in the various types.

original: rnam par smin pa la mchog dga'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mchog dga'o //
translated: Supreme joy is in the fully matured.

original: rnam par nyed pa la sna tshogs dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par nyed pa la sna tshogs dga' ba'o //
translated: In the dissolution of the signs, there is the joy of variety.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba la lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: In the absence of characteristics, there is the innate joy.

original: dga' bas bde ba cung zad bskyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bas bde ba cung zad bskyed par 'gyur te /
translated: Joy generates a slight bliss.

original: mchog gi dga' bas de las lhag par 'gyur pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: mchog gi dga' bas de las lhag par 'gyur pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Supreme joy generates a greater bliss than that.

original: sna tshogs dga' bas chags pa sna tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sna tshogs dga' bas chags pa sna tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: The joy of variety is the variety of attachments.

original: thams cad kyi lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi lhag ma ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: The remainder of all is the innate joy.

original: sngon mas ni reg bya la 'dod pa dang / gnyis pas bde ba la chags pa dang / gsum pas chags pa nyams pa dang / bzhi pas mchog tu bde ba'o //
analyzed: sngon mas ni reg bya la 'dod pa dang / gnyis pas bde ba la chags pa dang / gsum pas chags pa nyams pa dang / bzhi pas mchog tu bde ba'o //
translated: The first is the desire for tactile objects; the second is attachment to bliss; the third is the loss of attachment; and the fourth is supreme bliss.

original: mchog dang sna tshogs pa'i bar du ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: mchog dang sna tshogs pa'i bar du ni lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: Between the supreme and the variety is the innate.

original: gsum po 'di dag dang bral ba yin la gang gis kyang bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag dang bral ba yin la gang gis kyang bstan par mi nus te /

original: dga' ba dang po la gnas brtan pa'o //

analyzed: sprul pa dang / chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa ni la la n'a dang ra sa n'a dang aa wa dh'u t'i'o //

analyzed: de yang phyi dang nang du sems kyi rgyal po'i rnam par rol par shes par bya'o //

original: slob ma la ni bstan par bya //

original: don dam pa yis dbye bas ni //

analyzed: dbang ni thob par gyur pa yi //

analyzed: skyes bus ye shes shes par bya //

translated: Through embracing them, the faculties become one and the supreme joy arises.

analyzed: thams cad mnyes par 'gyur pa'i rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid dang bral ba ni sna tshogs @158a * //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyin pa'i dum bu ste bzhi pa'o /

analyzed: // / da ni shes rab ma rnams sbyin par bya ste /

analyzed: mi rig pa'i phyir rigs ngan ma ste rlung la'o //
translated: Since she is not known, she is a low-caste woman, that is, wind.

original: mda' zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga yin la /
analyzed: mda' zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga yin la /
translated: The “arrow” is the five faculties.

analyzed: de rnams gcig pa nyid du byed pas mda' mkhan ma ste sbyin pa la'o //
translated: The “fletcher” is in regard to generosity, since it unifies those.

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa skum par byed pas tshul khrims 'di la yod pas na ku tsi ni ste tshul khrims la'o //

analyzed: dga' bar byed pas na nandi ste bzod pa'o //

analyzed: gnyis po ma lus par byed pas na tsha mo ste brtson 'grus la'o //

analyzed: gzugs brnyan bzhin du sna tshogs pa ston par byed pas na gar mkhan ma ste bsam gtan la'o //
translated: The “dancer” is in regard to meditative stabilization, since it displays the variety like a reflection.

analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i dra bas spro ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i yid 'ching bar byed pas na nya ba mo ste shes rab la'o //
translated: The “fisherwoman” is in regard to wisdom, since it binds the mind with the net of realitylessness to the discursive thought of proliferation.

analyzed: bden pa'i chos rnams la rgyas gdab par byed pas na ma'i sgyug mo ste byams pa la'o //
translated: The mother-in-law is loving kindness, since it seals the true Dharma.

analyzed: byed pas na shing mkhan ma ste dga' ba la'o //
translated: The woodcutter is joy, since it cuts down the tree of conceptualization.

analyzed: ma lus pa'i sgrib pa med pas na lhag ma za mkhan ma ste btang snyoms 'a'o  //

analyzed: phyogs gnyis srub shing gis gzung bar byed pas na rdza mkhan ma ste lus la'o //

analyzed: rang gi ros 'gro ba smin par byed pas na chang 'tshong ma ste ngag la'o //
